definition: at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task

sentences.english: Now, there are some immediate bad explanations for this.
sentences.chinese: 马上就有人提出一些错漏百出的解释。

sentences.english: E-Gold used for now BUT their own payment processor soon!
sentences.chinese: 虽然现在用eg，但是马上就推出自己的网银。

sentences.english: In a moment, you'll begin to feel light-headed, then drowsy.
sentences.chinese: 马上，你会开始感到头晕，然后昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: Moses manages to placate God momentarily, and then he turns around to face the people.
sentences.chinese: 摩西想马上安抚上帝，他把脸转向人民。

sentences.english: Mrs. Black spent all her money betting on horses.
sentences.chinese: 布莱克夫人把她所有的钱都花在了赌马上。

sentences.english: Full jolly knight he seemd, and faire did sith.
sentences.chinese: 快乐的骑士在马上英姿飒爽。

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他们也喜欢喝马上冲马上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他们也喜欢喝马上冲马上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: Neal told Tan Ruiling the situation immediately.
sentences.chinese: 赵龙马上把情况告诉了谭睿玲。

sentences.english: Both men froze when they saw it was the Duke of Sui himself telling them to stop!
sentences.chinese: 两个人一看到是隋侯爷叫他们住手，马上停手了。

sentences.english: After my noon run, I rushed to the market to buy a lot of different spices.
sentences.chinese: 我中午跑完步之后，马上冲去买一大堆香料。

sentences.english: The phone gave me its IP address on my home network.
sentences.chinese: 电话的IP地址马上显示在我的家庭网络中。

sentences.english: And when she knew her man had married, she left right away.
sentences.chinese: 而且当她知道她所爱的人结过婚以后，她马上离开了。

sentences.english: The Tourney of Talent is about to begin.
sentences.chinese: 星光灿烂的比赛马上就要开始了。

sentences.english: We will begin the painful shock experiment in a moment.
sentences.chinese: 马上我们将要开始一个痛击实验。

sentences.english: The youngster immediately fell silent as tears welled up in his big blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩马上不吭声了，蓝色的大眼睛里涌满了泪水。

definition: in the first moments (of sth happening)/immediately (after an event)/first thing

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
in a short while/all at once/all of a sudden
to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
